item.title: Analyzing long win streaks in online chess
item.description: TL;DR: In-depth analysis of recent data suggests a high likelihood of Hikaru Nakamura achieving a 55-game winning streak in online blitz, based on thousands of his games played this year (and even more likely given that Hikaru just crossed 35,000 blitz games mark on Chess.com alone). Similarly, longest streaks by Magnus Carlsen (32 wins), Nihal Sarin (22 wins), and Daniel Naroditsky (33 wins) align with statistical expectations. The occurrence of both short (10+ wins) and long (15+ wins) streaks among these elite players is also found to be probable and not out of the ordinary.
item.author: (map[name:Kirill Bobyrev])

item.title: SQLSync - Stop building databases
item.description: Join me as we take a look at common application data patterns, and how they relate to the inner-workings of databases. In this post, we discuss data caching, indexing, optimistic mutations, and recursive cache invalidation. We will see how life might be easier if we could just use a frontend optimized database like SQLSync instead.

item.title: Why is curation of web search results important?
item.description: Mwmbl is the first search engine to allow users to change the search results: You can add results, delete them, and rerank them. The changes you made are saved instantly to the index and will be shown to other users who run the same query. But what is the point of users changing search results? There are far too many queries to expect them all to be curated by users.

item.title: .NET Conf 2023
item.description: .NET Conf is an annual conference dedicated to the world of Microsoft's .NET framework and related technologies. In 2023, .NET Conf promises to be an exciting event, bringing together developers, engineers, and tech enthusiasts from around the globe. Attendees can expect a dynamic program filled with informative sessions, keynote presentations, workshops, and networking opportunities.At .NET Conf 2023, participants will gain insights into the latest developments in the .NET ecosystem, including updates on .NET 7 and other cutting-edge technologies. They will have the chance to connect with industry experts, learn best practices, and explore practical use cases through hands-on demonstrations. Whether you're a seasoned developer or new to the world of .NET, this conference is a valuable opportunity to stay up-to-date and engage with the thriving .NET community..NET Hub Kathmandu is hosting local version of the .NET Conf 2023. Date: 02 December 2023Venue: To be announce soon
